person.persName: John S. Hays (Nashville, Tennesse, and Frankfort, Kentucky, minister)

body.p: Nashville, Tennesse, and Frankfort, Kentucky, minister. Washington County, Pennsylvania, native. Married to Frances M. Hays. Father of John L. Hays and Mary Bell Hays. Graduate of Jefferson College in Cannonsburg, Pennsylvania, in 1850. Graduate of Western Theological Seminary in Allegheny, Pennsylvania, in 1853. Clergy of the Old School Presbyterian Church. Minister in Charleston, Indiana, from 1853 to 1856. Minister of the Second Presbyterian Church in Nashville from 1856 to 1861. Minister of the Presybterian Church in Frankfort from 1862 to 1867.

bibl.p: Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedule, Tennessee, Davidson County, Nashville, Ward 2, p. 64; "Reverend J.S. Hays D.D." The Frankfort Roundabout (Frankfort, Ky.), January 14, 1899, p. 4.
